title: Cramer's Rule, Inverse Matrix and Volume

Session Overview Now we start to use the determinant. Understanding the cofactor formula allows us to show that _A_-1 = (1/detA)_C_T, where C is the matrix of cofactors of A. Combining this formula with the equation x = A-1b gives us Cramer’s rule for solving Ax = b. Also, the absolute value of the determinant gives the volume of a box.
